1526.short_description: kubernetes context already persisted with provider

1528.name: ErrTokenRevokeCode

1528.probable_cause: Unable to revoke token. Token appears to be a malformed base64 token.
1528.suggested_remediation: Try logging out (again) in order to fully close your session (and revoke the session token).

1529.name: ErrTokenIntrospectCode

1529.suggested_remediation: Login again to establish a new session with valid token.

1530.name: ErrShareDesignCode
1530.probable_cause:
email address provided might not be valid
insufficient permission
1530.suggested_remediation:
Ensure that you are the owner of the design you are sharing
Try again later
Try using an alternate email address

1531.name: ErrUnreachableRemoteProviderCode
1531.probable_cause: Remote provider server may be down or not accepting requests.
1531.suggested_remediation: Make sure remote provider server is healthy and accepting requests.

1532.name: ErrShareFilterCode
1532.probable_cause:
Email address provided might not be valid
Verify that you have sufficient permission to share the filter. You should be the owner of the filter
1532.suggested_remediation:
Verify the spelling of the email address. Try using an alternate email address.
Ensure that you are the owner of the filter you are sharing or have sharing permission assigned.

1533.name: ErrPersistEventCode
1533.probable_cause:
Database could be down or not reachable
Meshery Database handler is not accessible to perform operations
1533.suggested_remediation: Restart Meshery Server or Perform Hard Reset

1534.name: ErrUnreachableKubeAPICode
1534.probable_cause:
The Kubernetes API server is not reachable.
Credentials are invalid.
1534.suggested_remediation:
Verify network connectivity and Kubernetes API responsiveness between Meshery Server and your cluster.
Ensure client credential is not expired and is properly formed.
Remove the cluster credential and enable 'insecure-skip-tls-verify'.

1535.name: ErrFlushMeshSyncDataCode
1535.short_description: Unable to flush MeshSync data for context %s at %s
1535.probable_cause: Meshery Database handler is not accessible to perform operations
1535.suggested_remediation: Restart Meshery Server or Perform Hard Reset

1536.name: ErrDryRunCode
1536.short_description: error performing a dry run on the design

1537.name: ErrBulkUpdateEventCode
1537.short_description: Could not update status for one or more events.
1537.probable_cause:
Event has been deleted or does not exist.
The requested event status is invalid.
Meshery Database is corrupt.
1537.suggested_remediation:
Verify that the event still exists.
Verify that the requested event status is supported.
Visit Settings and reset the Meshery database.

1538.name: ErrBulkDeleteEventCode
1538.short_description: Could not delete one or more events.
1538.probable_cause:
Event has been deleted or does not exist.
Meshery Database is corrupt.
1538.suggested_remediation:
Confirm that the status you are using is valid and a supported event status. Refer to Meshery Docs for a list of event statuses. Check for availability of a new version of Meshery Server. Try upgrading to the latest version.
Visit Settings and reset the Meshery database.

1539.name: ErrFetchMeshSyncResourcesCode

DB might be corrupted
1539.probable_cause: MeshSync might not be reachable from meshery
1539.suggested_remediation:
Make sure meshery has connectivity to MeshSync
Try restarting Meshery server

1540.name: ErrUpdateConnectionStatusCode
1540.probable_cause:
Connection was already deleted

1540.suggested_remediation:
Try refresing, you might be seeing stale data on the dashboard
Check if the user has necessary privileges

1543.probable_cause: Provided ID is not a valid uuid.

1545.name: ErrCreatingKubernetesComponentsCode
1545.probable_cause:
component generation was canceled due to deletion or reload of K8s context
Invalid kubeconfig
Filters passed incorrectly in config
Could not fetch API resources from Kubernetes server
1545.suggested_remediation:
If there is the log \"Starting to register ...\" for the same contextID after this error means that for some reason the context was reloaded which caused this run to abort. In that case, this error can be ignored.
Make sure that the configuration filters passed are in accordance with output from /openapi/v2
